question: Which is the second largest coral reef system in the world?
explanation: Belize Barrier Reef is the second-largest coral reef system in the world. It is located on the Belize coast of the Caribbean Sea. It is a part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef system. Charles Darwin described it as the most remarkable reef in the West Indies. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It also houses Turneffe Atoll, Glovers Reef and Lighthouse Reef.
